bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Gene Carrier, January 20, 1953

div1.p: Hench requests Carrier's help in obtaining two photographs to use in an illustrated speech about the Camp Lazear dedication, at the Mayo Clinic.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Gene Carrier, January 20, 1953
div1.opener:
January 20, 1953
Mr. Gene Carrier
Calle Rufugio 106
Altos
Habana, Cuba
My dear Mr. Carrier:
div1.p:
I appreciated greatly your help in getting me some photo-
graphs of the Camp Lazear dedication last month. The Clinic has asked
me to present a story of the dedication before the staff meeting of the
Mayo Clinic some time soon.

I am writing a running story of the ceremony but would like
one or two missing photographs from which to make slides. I would ap-
preciate it greatly if you would help me get a glossy photograph which
appeared in the HAVANA POST, December 3, page 1, a photograph of Miss
Wood and others at the Hotel Nacional. It was marked “Foto Tirso”.

I don't know what Havana newspapers charge for photographs
but the American newspapers usually charge about $1.00. I enclose a
check marked “not over two dollars” and would appreciate it if you
would fill in the proper amount.
Thank you very much for your courtesy.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
